title: Let U be an open subset of a topological space X. How can you show that X − U is the largest open subsets of X that misses U? - Quora

response.answer_text: If U is an open subset of X then X-U will, by definition, be closed. The interior of X-U will be the largest open subset that is disjoint from U. To see this, let V be any open subset of X that misses U. Then V is an open subset of X-U and, therefore, a subset of the interior of X-U.
